titles.title: A joint resolution calling for an economic summit to deal with the financial crisis.

action.text: Introduced in the Senate. Read the first time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Read the First Time.

calendar.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 426.

action.text: Indefinitely postponed by Senate by Unanimous Consent.

bill.summary: 10/20/1987--Introduced. Calls upon the President to immediately convene a summit of the nation's economic leaders to develop and implement a plan to resolve the Nation's financial crisis by taking actions including: (1) stabilizing the dollar; (2) stabilizing interest rates; (3) calming equity and commodity markets; (4) reducing the Federal budget deficit; (5) significantly reducing the U.S. trade deficit; and (6) reducing the threat to financial markets and institutions posed by the debt burden of less developed countries.
